meanings.definition: The market for goods and services that are sold after the original sale of a product.
meanings.sent1: In the aftermarket, you can find accessories for your car that were not available at the dealership.
meanings.sent2: Many car owners prefer aftermarket parts because they are often more affordable.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke that in the aftermarket, you can even buy a turbocharged coffee maker!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like an aftermarket, offering unique solutions beyond the standard options.
meanings.sent5: The aftermarket was a treasure trove of possibilities, waiting to be explored.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or relating to the market for goods and services that are sold after the original sale of a product.
meanings.sent1: The aftermarket industry is constantly evolving with new innovations.
meanings.sent2: Customers appreciate the aftermarket support provided by the company.
meanings.sent3: She had an aftermarket approach to fashion, mixing and matching styles effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like aftermarket solutions, offering fresh perspectives to old problems.
meanings.sent5: The aftermarket modifications gave the product a whole new appeal.
